intro: Chrysanthemum gracillimum, commonly known as the slender chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
